Package interaction

Class GameInterface

  • java.lang.Object
    • interaction.GameInterface
  • public class GameInterface
extends java.lang.Object
    A more general for of the TextInterface class. It is used to interact with a game, using only coordinate and integer inputs. It validates all user inputs, and handles all of the Game function calls.
    Author:
    The Programmer (Comerstar)

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      GameInterface()
      Creates a game interface that interacts with an empty game.
      GameInterface​(Game game)
      Constructs a game interface which interacts with a given game.

    • Method Detail

      • playerInput

        public java.util.ArrayList<AnimationCommand> playerInput​(int[] coordinateNumber,
                                                         int commandNumber,
                                                         int commandType,
                                                         GamePanel gamePanel)
        Responds to player input and performs the relevant actions to the game. This function handles the user input in two forms, coordinates that are for selecting tiles, and commands that are used from selection from menus. The function validates the user input, and checks, using game, that they are a valid action. The gameInterface then acts accordingly, either changing the stage that the user is on, or the updating game. It returns a list of animationCommands that command the GamePanel.
        Parameters:
        coordinateNumber - The coordinate input from the player
        commandNumber - The integer input of the player
        commandType - Whether the input is a coordinate or a number.
        gamePanel - The gamePanel through which the user did the input.
        Returns:
        A list of AnimationCommands that command the GamePanel to animate sprites or update sprite states.
        See Also:
        Game, GamePanel, AnimationCommand

      • playerMenuChoice

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> playerMenuChoice()
        Returns the names of the menu options that should appear. This depends on the state. The menu names are based off the playerInput(int[], int, int, GamePanel) function.
        Returns:
        The list of option names that the player has.
        See Also:
        playerInput(int[], int, int, GamePanel)

      • playerAction

        @Deprecated
public java.util.ArrayList<AnimationCommand> playerAction​(int[] coordinateNumber,
                                                          int commandNumber,
                                                          int commandType,
                                                          GamePanel gamePanel)
        Deprecated.
        Deprecated due to using an out-of-date interaction system. Replaced by #playerInput(int[], int, int, GamePanel).
        Responds to user input and calls the relevant game functions. Handles all of the user input validation.
        Parameters:
        coordinateNumber - The coordinates that the user has inputed.
        commandNumber - The number that the user inputed.
        commandType - Whether the input was a number or a coordinate.
        gamePanel - The GamePanel through which the user inputed the information
        Returns:
        Returns a list of animation commands for the gamePanel to perform.
        See Also:
        playerInput(int[], int, int, GamePanel)
